title: Southend-on-Sea
summary: Southend-on-Sea (/saʊθˌɛnd-/ (listen)), commonly referred to simply as Southend, is a large coastal town  and unitary authority area with borough status in southeastern Essex, England. It lies on the north side of the Thames Estuary, 40 miles (64 km) east of central London. It is bordered to the north by Rochford and to the west by Castle Point. It is home to the longest pleasure pier in the world, Southend Pier.[2] London Southend Airport is located north of the town centre.
